title: Baghdadi's annihilation will have gone some way to restoring Donald Trump’s standing
text:
The annihilation of the Isil leader has won the US President timely credit - though questions remain

President Donald Trump has received his fair share of criticism over his handling of the Syrian Kurds, the erstwhile allies who helped end the barbaric regime of Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (Isil).

The daring operation by US special forces that has resulted in the death of Isil leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi will have gone some way to restoring the President’s domestic and international standing.

It was not just Mr Trump’s Democratic opponents who took issue with the decision to remove US forces from northern Syria earlier this month, thereby allowing the Turks to commence their military...
description: The annihilation of the Isil leader has won the US President timely credit - though questions remain
